item.title: Installing .NET core, PowerShell and PowerCLI on macOS Sierra
item.description: So, this is something I’ve been waiting to write up for a while! PowerShell for macOS has been available for a while now, but what a lot ofÂ PowerCLI fans have been waiting for is to be able to use PowerCLI direct from their Mac. Today, amidst all of the noise from VMWorld, PowerCLI Core dropped as a Fling! That means that although it’s not ready for production use yet, it is ready to start testing - and I’m way more excited than I should be!
